translated: Carl Salomon, practical farmer, Växjö, born on January 28, 1897, in Haltostad, to first postmaster Emil W. and Mathilda Benigtsson. Married on November 21. Wife's name is Ingrid Katarina Holmqvist. Children: Bengt-Göran (born in 1922), Alf Emil (born in 1928), Ulla Lena (born in 1929). Completed his studies in Halmstad in 1915, obtained a Bachelor of Medicine in Lund in 1919, and a medical license in Stockholm in 1924. Served as temporary district medical officer in Älvsby, Äknihults, and Malungs districts from 1922 to 1924. Worked as an assistant at the Karolinska Institute's dermatology-syphilidology clinic from 1921 to 1925, and as a temporary district medical officer in Sunne, Lycksele, and Strängnäs districts for approximately a year from 1925 to 1929. Also served as a temporary assistant at Västervik and Halmstad hospitals, Seraf Hospital's surgical department, and Gothenburg's maternity ward for about fifteen months from 1926 to 1928. Became a second lieutenant at Växjö Hospital from 1920 to 1931, and then the first district medical officer there from 1931 to 1934. Worked as a practicing physician in Växjö since 1934. Undertook study trips to Vienna in 1921 and made annual trips to Europe from 1928 to 1939. Wrote a prize-winning paper on syphilis in the series "What we know." Made presentations on medical topics in lectures organized by Föreläsn and ABF. Ingrid Katarina (Holmqvist), author, Växjö, born in Karlskrona to J. O. Holmqvist and h.h. Married on November 21 to practical physician Carl W. Passed the primary school exam in 1911 and studied languages at a secondary school in Stockholm. Made annual trips to Europe from 1928 to 1939. Employed at primary and secondary schools in Skatelöv, Torhamn, and Älmhult from 1911 to 1925. Served on the board of a state continuation school for speech education in Växjö from 1938 and on the Women's Preparedness Committee. Also a member of Växjö youth council. Wrote several books, textbooks, and children's literature such as "The Children of Lillköping," a reading book for primary school (volume I and II, 1927), "Gullstugan," a supplementary reading book for primary school (1933), "Guide to Fröbel's Work and Stick Crafts" (1924), and "Children's Song Collection: Knäckkalaset" (1924), "Sockerlandet" (1927), "Lillebrors visor" (1932), "Reading Book on Hygiene and Health: Hälsans ABC-bok" (1933, translated into Norwegian), "Children's First Christmas Book, Christmas Reading for Beginners" (1932), "Tomtenisse, Christmas Reading for Beginners" (annual from 1933), "Winged People" (part of the series "Our Wonderful World," 1933), "A Straw to the Stack" (in the same series, 1946), "We Want to be Healthy" (same series, 1948), "In Hopperland," useful and entertaining reading for beginners (1944), "The King's Little Doctor" (1944), "Us and Our Health" (1948). Also contributed to radio programs for children since 1925 and collaborated on textbooks for primary school and "My Little School Friend."
